channel.title: [PI] Multiple portals per id?
channel.description: k so i realize there are a bunch of portal object ids, but im planning on making a minigame with a bunch of portals in it, so i was wondering if there is any way to make multiple portals with the same id? thanks :D

item.description:
@dylan.hurley wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:2, topic:424878”]You could create a variable, and under whatever handles your object clicks, lets use a switch statement for an example,

case 9999:
    if(MYVARIABLE == 1) {
    } else if (MYVARIABLE == 2) {
}
break;

You see?[/quote]
Well what if it’s not variable of ethir?

item.title: [PI] Multiple portals per id?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Here is the quote from oracle,

[quote=Oracle]
The if-then-else statement provides a secondary path of execution when an “if” clause evaluates to false. You could use an if-then-else statement in the applyBrakes method to take some action if the brakes are applied when the bicycle is not in motion. In this case, the action is to simply print an error message stating that the bicycle has already stopped.

Read full topic
